isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CONTROL ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove upper driver side defrost trim panel (one screw on top and one on the side) ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Remove Upper Driver Side Defrost Trim Panel

step1.para: Remove the seven (7) screws that secure the left lower instrument panel cover in place and remove the panel ( Figure 12).
Remove the two (2) screws that hold the control assembly in place and pull assembly toward you to expose the back side of the assembly ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Pull Knob(s) Off Cable Actuator Shaft(s) Protruding Through Control Assembly Cover

step1.para: To remove a cable actuator from the control panel cover, pull the knob(s) off the cable actuator shaft(s) that protrude through the control assembly cover ( Figure 13). Remove the hex nut that secures the cable actuator to the cover ( Figure 13) and remove the actuator from the cover. Unsnap the control cable from the actuator and remove the actuator.

To remove each control cable, it will be necessary to disconnect the defrost control cable from the defrost door in the heater-A/C duct, up under the instrument panel and the temperature control cable, from the Blend-Air door lever on the heater-A/C unit. Refer to BLEND-AIR DOOR, Remove .
Install the control unit by feeding the defrost and temperature control cables behind the instrument panel to the door they control.
Secure the control panel to the instrument panel with two (2) screws.
Install the left lower instrument panel cover with seven (7) screws ( Figure 12).
Install the upper driver side defrost trim panel with one screw on top and one on the side ( Figure 12).

Connect the defrost cable to the defrost air duct up under the instrument panel ( Figure 1). Connect the temperature control cable to the Blend-Air door in the heater-A/C unit ( Figure 1). The defrost setting on the control panel is self adjusting.

If it is necessary to adjust the temperature control knob, turn the knob (center knob on the heater-A/C control panel) ( Figure 14) to full cool mode. The end of the blue color should line up with the index line on the panel ( Figure 14). If it doesn't line up, turn the turnbuckle ( Figure 1and Figure 14) on the temperature control cable until the end of the blue color lines up with the index line on the panel.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Line Up Blue Color With Index Line on Panel
